sentences.en: An eighteenth - century satirist reviewed the troublesome period.
sentences.cn: 一位18世纪的讽刺作家对这一动乱时期作了评论.

sentences.en: As a political satirist, scurrility was his trade, you might say.
sentences.cn: 作为政治讽刺作家, 恶言诽谤也许可算是他的行业.

sentences.en: Does it matter that a satirist tells his 80,000 Twitter followers that he thinks Starbucks stinks?
sentences.cn: 一位讽刺作家对他的8万名Twitter关注者说星巴克有异味,可是这件事重要 吗 ?

sentences.en: He built a reputation in the 1970s as a social satirist.
sentences.cn: 他在20世纪70年代作为社会讽刺作家而出名。

sentences.en: Swift wrote a great deal of poetry, but he is best regarded as a prose satirist.
sentences.cn: 史威特写过许多诗, 但却以散文讽刺作家著称.

sentences.en: To paraphrase the satirist Tom Lehrer, it makes a fellow proud to be a banker.
sentences.cn: 套用讽刺作家汤姆?莱勒(TomLehrer) 的说法, 这让人觉得作为一名银行家很自豪.

sentences.en: Voltaire was a famous French satirist.
sentences.cn: 伏尔泰是法国一位著名的讽刺作家.
